com.camerontec.catalys.util.text.number

Class InternalNumberConversionUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.camerontec.catalys.util.text.number.InternalNumberConversionUtil
  • Deprecated. 
    Use AsciiNumberConversionUtil instead.

    public final class InternalNumberConversionUtil
extends Object
    Some utility methods for converting between Strings and numbers. Note: as the name implies this utility class is intended for internal Catalys use. Third parties should not rely on the functionality or interface offered by this class.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static InternalNumberConversionUtil getInstance(int maxEfficientDigits)
        Deprecated. 
        Returns an instance of this class initialized with the specified maxEfficientDigits.

        Note that the larger the number of efficient digits, the more memory is used by this class.

        Parameters:
        maxEfficientDigits - int The maximum number of digits for which this class will work efficiently.
        Returns:
        an instance of this class
        Throws:
        NumberFormatException - if the US-ASCII character set is not supported by this JVM

      • getInstance

        public static InternalNumberConversionUtil getInstance()
        Deprecated. 
        Returns an instance of this class initialized with 4 as the maximum number of digits for which this class will work efficiently.
        Returns:
        an instance of this class
        Throws:
        NumberFormatException - if the US-ASCII character set is not supported by this JVM

      • getMaxEfficientDigits

        public int getMaxEfficientDigits()
        Deprecated. 
        This is the number of digits in the maximum number for which these methods will work most efficiently.

        The default number of efficient digits is 4. That means that the methods in this class will work most efficiently for numbers in the range: 0-9999

        Returns:
        int The maximum number of digits for which this class works efficiently.

      • getMaxLookupInts

        public int getMaxLookupInts()
        Deprecated. 
        The maximum number handled efficiently by this class plus one.

        This number is simply calculated from the maximum number of efficient digits. It is 10 to the power of that number. So, for example, when the maximum number of efficient digits is 4 (the default), this method will return 10000 (9999 + 1).

        Returns:
        int Maximum efficient number plus one.

      • asciiBytesToLong

        public static long asciiBytesToLong(byte[] bytes,
                                    int offset,
                                    int length)
        Deprecated. 
        Converts a byte array to a long, assuming that the bytes are ASCII decimal digits and a possible '-' sign.

        The conversion is fast and does not create any intermediate objects (eg a String).

        Parameters:
        bytes - Byte array representation of a number.
        offset - Start of byte sequence in array.
        length - Number of bytes making up number.
        Returns:
        The converted long.
        Throws:
        NumberFormatException - if the array is null, or length is 0, or the array does not contain a whole number in the Long range.

      • asciiBytesToInt

        public static int asciiBytesToInt(byte[] bytes,
                                  int offset,
                                  int length)
        Deprecated. 
        Converts a byte array to an int, assuming that the bytes are ASCII decimal digits and a possible '-' sign.

        The conversion is fast and does not create any intermediate objects (eg a String).

        Parameters:
        bytes - Byte array representation of a number.
        offset - Start of byte sequence in array.
        length - Number of bytes making up number.
        Returns:
        The converted int.
        Throws:
        NumberFormatException - if the array is null, or length is 0, or the array does not contain a whole number in the Integer range.

      • asciiBytesToPositiveInt

        public static int asciiBytesToPositiveInt(byte[] bytes,
                                          int offset,
                                          int length)
        Deprecated. 
        Converts part of a byte array to a integer, assuming that the bytes are ASCII characters representing a positive whole number in the Integer range.

        This conversion is very fast - especially for small numbers.

        Parameters:
        bytes - Byte array representation of a positive integer number.
        offset - Start of byte sequence in array.
        length - Number of bytes making up number.
        Returns:
        The converted integer.
        Throws:
        NumberFormatException - if the array is null, or length is 0, or the array does not contain a positive whole number in the Integer range.

      • asciiStringToPositiveInt

        public static int asciiStringToPositiveInt(String s)
        Deprecated. 
        Converts a String to a positive integer.

        This conversion is very fast - especially for small numbers. However, it does no checking (other than for null and empty string) and it does not handle negative numbers.

        Parameters:
        s - String representation of a positive integer.
        Returns:
        The converted integer.
        Throws:
        NumberFormatException - if the String is null or empty.

      • asciiBytesToDouble

        public static double asciiBytesToDouble(byte[] bytes,
                                        int offset,
                                        int length)
        Deprecated. 
        Converts a byte array to a double, assuming that the bytes are ASCII decimal digits and a possible '-' sign.

        The conversion is fast and does not create any intermediate objects (e.g. String).

        Parameters:
        bytes - Byte array representation of a number.
        offset - Start of byte sequence in array.
        length - Number of bytes making up number.
        Returns:
        The converted double.
        Throws:
        NumberFormatException - if the array is null, or length is 0, or the array does not contain a whole number in the Long range in either the whole or fractional parts.

      • asciiBytesAsMutableCompactDecimal

        public static MutableCompactDecimal asciiBytesAsMutableCompactDecimal(byte[] bytes,
                                                                      int offset,
                                                                      int length,
                                                                      MutableCompactDecimal value)
        Deprecated. 
        Converts a byte array to a MutableCompactDecimal, assuming that the bytes are ASCII decimal digits and a possible '-' sign.

        The conversion is fast and does not create any intermediate objects (e.g. String).

        Parameters:
        bytes - Byte array representation of a number.
        offset - Start of byte sequence in array.
        length - Number of bytes making up number.
        value - the target value
        Returns:
        The converted double.
        Throws:
        NumberFormatException - if the array is null, or length is 0, or the array does not contain a whole number in the Long range in either the whole or fractional parts.

      • asciiBytesToBigDecimal

        public static BigDecimal asciiBytesToBigDecimal(byte[] bytes,
                                                int offset,
                                                int length)
        Deprecated. 
        Converts a byte array to a BigDecimal, assuming that the bytes are ASCII decimal digits and a possible '-' sign.

        This method is only suitable when:

        • The desired scale is 0
        • The desired precision is unlimited

        Unless the above conditions are met this method should not be used.

        Note also that the method fails unless it is possible to represent the unscaled value as a Long. The caller must therefore be prepared to catch java.lang.NumberFormatException and handle accordingly.

        No intermediate double values are used in this calculation so, provided the unscaled value can be represented as a Long, no precision is lost.

        Parameters:
        bytes - Byte array representation of a number.
        offset - Start of byte sequence in array.
        length - Number of bytes making up number.
        Returns:
        The converted BigDecimal. The scale is 0 and the precision is unspecified.
        Throws:
        NumberFormatException - if the array is null, or length is 0, or the array does not contain a number for which both the whole and fractional parts cannot treated as unscaled values in the Long range.

      • divideBy100

        public static String divideBy100(String n)
        Deprecated. 
        Divides a decimal value represented by a string by 100.
        Parameters:
        n - the string representation of a decimal value
        Returns:
        the string representation of the decimal value divided by 100

      • positiveIntTo2AsciiBytes

        public byte[] positiveIntTo2AsciiBytes(int n)
        Deprecated. 
        Converts a one or two digit positive integer to 2 bytes using the US-ASCII charset necessary.

        This conversion is very fast.

        Parameters:
        n - Integer to be converted.
        Returns:
        The converted bytes.

      • positiveIntTo3AsciiBytes

        public byte[] positiveIntTo3AsciiBytes(int n)
        Deprecated. 
        Converts a one or two or three digit positive integer to 3 bytes using the US-ASCII charset (with leading 0's if necessary).

        This conversion is very fast.

        Parameters:
        n - Integer to be converted.
        Returns:
        The converted bytes.

        This conversion is very fast.

        Parameters:
        n - Integer to be converted.
        Returns:
        The converted String.

      • longToAsciiBytes

        public static void longToAsciiBytes(long n,
                                    BytesSegment buffer)
        Deprecated. 
        Convert a long to ascii bytes using a buffer. This method has zero object creation.
        Parameters:
        n - the number to convert in the range Long.MAX_VALUE, Long.MIN_VALUE + 1.
        buffer - the buffer to populate.

      • longToAsciiBytes

        public static void longToAsciiBytes(long n,
                                    BytesSegment buffer,
                                    int index)
        Deprecated. 
        Convert a long to ascii bytes using a buffer. This method has zero object creation.
        Parameters:
        n - the number to convert in the range Long.MAX_VALUE, Long.MIN_VALUE + 1.
        buffer - the buffer to populate.
        index - an index where to start.

      • mutableCompactDecimalToAsciiBytes

        public static void mutableCompactDecimalToAsciiBytes(MutableCompactDecimal value,
                                                     BytesSegment buffer,
                                                     int index)
        Deprecated. 
        Convert a MutableCompactDecimal to ascii bytes using a buffer.

        The conversion is done using the minimum number of significant digits possible. That is, 0 is converted to the byte equivalent of "0" not "0.0". This is consistent with java.math.BigDecimal.toPlainString().

        Parameters:
        value - The value.
        buffer - The target buffer.
        index - The index at which to place the ascii bytes.

      • intToAsciiBytes

        public byte[] intToAsciiBytes(int n)
        Deprecated. 
        Converts an integer to a byte array using the US-ASCII charset.

        This conversion is very fast for small numbers.

        Parameters:
        n - Integer to be converted to a byte array.
        Returns:
        The converted byte array.

      • longToAsciiBytes

        This conversion is very fast for small numbers.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        The converted byte array.
